metadata.title: CVE-2022-2663 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was found in the Linux kernel in nf_conntrack_irc where themessage handling can be confused and incorrectly matches the message. Afirewall may be able to be bypassed when users are using unencrypted IRCwith nf_conntrack_irc configured.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2663` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-204-generic - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-4.15.0-204-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-4.15.0-204-lowlatency - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-204-generic - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-204-lowlatency - 4.15.0-204.215
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-136-generic - 5.4.0-136.153~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-204.215').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-136.153~18.04.1').
